meanings.definition: Of or relating to an eparchy.
meanings.sent1: The eparchial council made decisions for the local church.
meanings.sent2: The eparchial boundaries were clearly defined.
meanings.sent3: The eparchial dress code required all clergy to wear specific robes.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was eparchial, guiding the community with wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The eparchial architecture of the cathedral was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the jurisdiction of an eparch.
meanings.sent1: The eparchial authority extended over multiple parishes.
meanings.sent2: The eparchial court handled legal matters within the diocese.
meanings.sent3: The eparchial traffic laws were strictly enforced.
meanings.sent4: His influence was eparchial, shaping policies across the region.
meanings.sent5: The eparchial boundaries marked the extent of his rule.

meanings.definition: Involving or characteristic of an eparchy.
meanings.sent1: The eparchial celebrations brought the community together.
meanings.sent2: The eparchial traditions were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The eparchial cuisine featured unique dishes from the region.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the eparchial cause inspired others to join.
meanings.sent5: The eparchial customs reflected the rich history of the area.
